results.title: Welcome to the dollhouse
results.brief_description: Todd Solondz’s debut feature is a darkly funny and bleak tale of the trials and horrors of high school outsiders. “Welcome to the Dollhouse” exacts with excruciating and all too familiar detail the ritualistic and cut throat pecking order of a New Jersey high school. In the title role Solondz has found an unusual alter ego in eleven year old Dawn Wiener (Heather Matarazzo), whose thick glasses, social awkwardness and infantile dress sense have marked her with the cruel nickname of Wiener dog. This has made her into the prime target for every high school bully including Brandon (Brendon Sexton the 3rd), a vicious delinquent who is constantly threatening to rape Dawn after school. Brandon’s promise of sexual assault become one of the many obstacles Dawn must deal with in her unrelenting journey through puberty, along with unsympathetic parents, a younger prissy sister that is unbearably wholesome, and a painful crush on the dreamy school rebel Steve (Eric Mabius). Cast also includes Daria Kalinina, Matthew Faber and Dimitri Iervolino. (Awards: Winner of the Grand Jury Prize at the 1996 Sundance Film Festival)

results.title: To live till you die
results.creator_credit: Robert Morgan, J.C. Sheers, ABC, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, National Educational Television and Rediffusion
results.brief_description: Explores the problems of old age and retirement in two different societies. 83-year-old Olivia is placed in an old people’s home in Sweden’s welfare state, in contrast to the great grandfather of the southern Italian Filazzola family, who still plays a part in supporting the family.

results.title: To know the Hurons
results.creator_credit: George Appleby, Haverand Productions and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates a new style of excavation used for archaeological work at the Draper site north of Toronto where there are remains of a large Huron village. With financial support from Transport Canada and the Archaeological Surveys of Canada, all the findings were fed into a computer, resulting in far more comprehensive information than would have been the case under the old system. Voice and narration: William D. Finlayson. (Award: Verona.)

results.title: Weekly review: new settlers
results.creator_credit: Cedric Herbert, Oxley Hughan, Stanhope Andrews and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Migrant assimilation in New Zealand. Shows the arrival of 800 displaced persons from Europe (post WWII) and subsequent activities at the reception centre at Pahiatua. Illustrates how New Zealand provides for the establishment and welfare of migrants and how these new arrivals are accustoming themselves to New Zealand conditions and way of life.

results.title: To serve the mind
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The dramatization of the sympathetic hospital treatment a general practitioner receives when he suffers a mental breakdown. There is an emphasis on the types of facilities available and on the wide variety of mental and emotional ailments which can be cured or alleviated with medical knowledge.

results.title: The World according to Garp
results.creator_credit: George Roy Hill, Robert L. Crawford and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: This film version of John Irving’s novel “The World According to Garp” brilliantly captures the quirky spirit of the original story. T.S. Garp is the illegitimate child of unorthodox feminist Jenny Fields. Every effort made by Jenny to broaden Garp’s outlook on life crams more fears and phobias into his psyche. Aspiring to become a novelist, Garp succeeds in this goal at the same time that his mother achieves fame through the publishing of her first feminist manifesto. Though successful and happily married to his college sweetheart, Garp remains envious of his fearless mother. Cast includes: Robin Williams, Mary Beth Hurt, Glenn Close and John Lithgow.

results.title: The World about us: tropical rain forest
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates the inter-relationships between the rich variety of plant and animal life and the warm humid environment of the tropical rain forest. Shows the layered structure of the vegetation, describes conditions of temperature and rainfall, and provides examples of both typical and rare species of animal and plant life.

results.title: The World's greatest stunts
results.creator_credit: William Kronick, Gary Benz and GRB Entertainment
results.brief_description: The history of filmmaking is filled with daring stunts that can make a film memorable by suspending our belief in the scene. Stuntmen and women have risked their lives continually since film began in order to entertain us. Covering all types of stunts from the car chase, fight scenes, explosions, trick riding and aerial jumps, this documentary celebrates the stunt men and women’s contribution to the film industry. Some of the greatest stunt people of modern Hollywood are mentioned, including: Terry Leonard; Tommy Huff; Norman Howell; Kerry Cullin; Joe Dunn; Hal Needham; Bennie Dobbins; Jack Gill. Interviews are provided with: Mel Gibson; Arnold Schwarzenegger; Michael Douglas; Charlton Heston; Tom Selleck and Patrick Swayze. Excerpts include: ‘Rambo’; ‘Romancing the stone’; ‘The Road warrior (Mad Max)’; ‘Ben Hur’; ‘Red heat’; ‘Apocalypse now’; ‘Roadhouse’; ‘Pink Panther’; ‘Running man’; ‘Octopussy’; ‘Stage Coach’ and many more.

results.title: The World's Greatest Photography Course
results.creator_credit: Hal Rein, Howard J. Blumenthal and VCA Programs
results.brief_description: Photographer Lief Ericksenn hosts this instructional course that guides the viewer through various photographic techniques aimed at improving your pictures. He introduces ways of developing your visual skills, suggests how to use your camera creatively, outlining camera functions and advising on the selection of film and appropriate lenses to achieve interesting and professional results.

results.title: The World's best known dicks
results.brief_description: Presented by John Thursday - Private Eye (Thom Depres), this documentary contains many wonderful excerpts and trailers from some of those classic detective films of the 30s and 40s, many of which were based on novels. Includes Peter Lorre in “Mysterious Mr Moto” (1938) and “Mr Moto’s last warning” (1939), Basil Rathbone in “The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes” (1939), William Powell as Philo Vance in “The Kennel murder case” (1933), Ralph Byrd as Dick Tracy in “Dick Tracy meets gruesome” (1947), Ronald Colman as Bulldog Drummond and many more of your favourite stars and co-stars, sleuths and villains in all manner of mysteries and mayhem.
